author: aharon
title: CA Guidelines Joint Drafting
description: Adjusting and agreeing on the community's roles and responsibilities set out in the guidelines lacks suitable tooling and processes.

author: itra2
title: Enable educated CA decisions
description: How can we ensure that CA will make educated decisions?

author: dimitri777
title: Structured Questionnaire for CAs
description: Having been a CA in two funding rounds I see difficulty in the way CAs are supposed to assess proposals. Lack of structure is a main issue

author: kenricnelson
title: Improving Integrity of CA Processes
description: The (v)CA assessments of Catalyst proposals require the highest level of integrity possible to ensure the selection of the best proposals.

author: fhilip.k
title: CA-tool Dev & Maintenance - AIM
description: The CA-tool needs fund-on-fund updates and maintenance and additional features developed..

author: fhilip.k
title: vCA-tool Dev & Maitain - AIM
description: The vCA-tool needs to be updated for each fund. Additional features can be added.

author: fractalfuzion
title: Community Advisors Marketing Blitz
description: Many Cardano users are unaware of project catalyst and community advisor role specifically. There is not enough Marketing. Lets fix it!

author: yutazzz
title: dRep's Code of Ethics+Bridges Asia
description: There is no discussion of the rules required for dRep. Japanese mass ADA holders cannot understand English-speaking dRep's talk

author: tvauce
title: CA Improvement Mechanism
description: Through 7 rounds of Catalyst funding, the role of CA is still controversial such as signs of using bots, poor reviews.

author: francek
title: Incremental CA assessments
description: Time available in the Assess stage alone is maybe not enough to garner a larger assessment rate which are also of high quality.

author: nadiahopkins
title: CA/VCA Treasury for Rapid Funding
description: The CA/VCA group has ongoing operational/improvement needs a treasury will sustainably address by enabling the rapid funding of solutions.

author: natnael
title: CA Academy Certification
description: How do we ensure our CAs have enough understanding about our mission at catalyst before assessing proposals?
